description: Particulate Matter (PM10) - Particles with diameters that are 10 micrometers and smaller
Particulate Matter (PM2.5) - Fine inhalable particles with diameters that are 2.5 micrometers and smaller
units: which can penetrate deep into the lungs.

description: Nitrogen Dioxide (NO2) - A gas that can irritate airways in the human respiratory system.
Sulfur Dioxide (SO2) - A gas that can cause respiratory problems and other health issues.

units: odorless gas that can cause harmful health effects by reducing the amount of oxygen that can be transported in the bloodstream to critical parts of the body.

description: Ozone (O3) - A gas composed of three oxygen atoms
units: high levels of which can cause respiratory issues.

description: Air Quality Index (AQI) - A number used to communicate how polluted the air currently is or how polluted it is forecast to become.
